page.title: 17Legends and Ghosts.
page.content: There are many old legends and ghost stories associated with the area - a headless Roman legionary has been seen. He is descibed as having bare legs and a helmet and has been spotted galloping close to the battlefield. The most well known story is that of the Grey Lady of Bosworth Hall. The story concerns the owners' daughter, Jane, who was courting the gardeners son, to the disapproval of her father. To prevent this clandestine relationship, the father set a mantrap which tragically Jane fell into - she was badly wounded and infirm until her death, and her ghost is said th haunt her old room which is now part of Bosworth Infirmary, an old peoples hospital. Many people claim to have seen her, and there is said to be a blood stain on the ceiling near to the fireplace. This is Janes blood.
